articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: Her job was to take care of these seniors. She stole from them instead, police say
articles.description: The Lexington County Sheriff's Department arrested and charged an employee of Columbia Presbyterian retirement community for burglary after she was accused of stealing jewelry from seniors under the West Columbia, SC woman's care.

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: Lexington County doctor charged in fatal shooting of Columbia salesman, police say
articles.description: Dr. Adam Lazzarini, who works for Lexington Medical Center, was charged with involuntary manslaughter and obstructing justice for his role in the fatal shooting of a Columbia, SC salesman at a Cayce residence, according to police.

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: Some SC hospitals get 'A's for safety — but in Columbia it's mostly 'C's, report card says
articles.description: The Leapfrog Group published its bi-annual Hospital Safety Scores, evaluating South Carolina hospitals on errors, accidents, injuries and infections that collectively are the third leading cause of death in the United States., and 14 As were scored.

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: His wife died Tuesday, but Lexington doctor was charged in another death days later, coroner says
articles.description: The wife of Dr. Adam Lazzarini, who works for Lexington Medical Center, was found dead in her Cayce home May 1, 2018. On May 3, Lazzarini was charged in the fatal shooting of a Columbia, SC salesman at the same residence, according to the coroner.

articles.author: By Maayan Schechter mschechter@thestate.com
articles.title: Poor SC mothers, children's health care at risk with new Medicaid mandate, study says
articles.description: S.C. Gov. McMaster has directed the S.C. Health and Human Services agency to seek a federal waiver to allow the state to require able-bodied Medicaid patients to work. Critics say it will mostly hurt mothers and children in rural counties.

articles.title: Palmetto Health Tuomey offers heart health screenings, events - Sumter Item
articles.description: Sumter Item Palmetto Health Tuomey offers heart health screenings, events Sumter Item February is American Heart Month, and Palmetto Health is offering a series of free screenings, seminars and events led by cardiac providers with expertise in their fields. F…

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: When she got on American Airlines plane, SC woman 'stepped into her coffin,' her lawyer says
articles.description: A Lexington, SC woman who was returning to Columbia with her husband to pursue her studies as a nurse became ill on an American Airlines flight from Hawaii to Texas and died in the hospital after suffering an embolism, according to a lawsuit.

articles.title: Two killed, six injured in Fort Jackson incident - The State
articles.description: The State Two killed, six injured in Fort Jackson incident The State Two soldiers died and six more were injured, two critically, in what's being called an accident at Fort Jackson, the U.S. Army's largest training installation. The Friday afternoon incident …

articles.author: By Alex Kincaid akincaid@islandpacket.com
articles.title: It's not the first time SC owner of 12 dead dogs has had complaints, police say
articles.description: The investigation into 12 dead dogs found at Lands End Road in Sea Pines is ongoing, according to Beaufort County Sheriff's Office spokesperson Capt. Bob Bromage. The owner has had at least three previous incidents in Bacon County, Georgia.

articles.author: By Susan Ardis smardis@thestate.com
articles.title: Where to find whole hog barbecue in SC (and a festival that honors the tradition)
articles.description: Barbecue in South Carolina, by traditional definition, is a whole hog, cooked low and slow over a wood fire. It’s hard, hot, time-consuming work to bring a perfectly cooked and … Click to Continue »
